reasoning: Posterior tibial tendon dysfunction (PTTD) is the most common cause of adult-acquired flatfoot. Affects primarily women >40 years. Incidence estimated 3-5 per 100k person-years based on orthopedic epidemiology studies. Risk factors include obesity, age, and diabetes. Higher prevalence in populations with metabolic disease.
source: Needleman RL. (1990). Current topic review: Posterior tibial tendon dysfunction. Foot Ankle Int. 11(6):428-435
